title: Gorgonzola Biscuits
introduction: Delight in the savory richness of Gorgonzola Biscuits, a perfect blend of creamy gorgonzola dolce and subtle spices, baked to golden perfection. These delectable biscuits, inspired by traditional Italian flavors, make an excellent appetizer or snack, bringing a touch of Lombardy right to your table.
ingredients: 8 ounces imported Italian gorgonzola dolce, rind removed
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter until it is fluffy. Add the cheese a little at a time, beating until well blended. Beat in the egg yolks, nutmeg, and pepper.
Add the flour and stir until smooth. Shape the dough into a disk and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 30 minutes up to overnight.
Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 450Â°F. Butter and flour a large baking sheet.

Roll out the dough between two sheets of plastic wrap to a 1/4-inch thickness. With a 2-inch round cookie cutter, cut out the biscuits. Place the biscuits on the prepared baking sheet. Gather the scraps together and, handling them as little as possible, roll out and cut the dough scraps in the same way. Brush the tops with the beaten egg white. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds.
Bake 12 to 14 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Serve at room temperature. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.
